title: Solo
opening: Overcoming many hardhsips,  Ike and company finally arrive in theDaein capital of Nevassa. However, much to their dismay, King Ashnard is nowhere to be found. According to intellegence reports,  the king is in Crimea's capital of Melior, preparing to wage war against Gallia. In addition, at least half of the Daein army, including its most elite forces, remain unharmed and at his side. The Crimean army is again forced to march. This time, however, the battlefield will be their own homeland. Eagerly awaiting their arrival is a Daein army more powerful than anything they have faced so far. This fact, coupled with Nasir's act of betrayal, has filled Ike with apprehension and disappointment. Yet, it is then, when all hope seems faint, that unexpected good news arrives.

intro.speaker: Begnion Soldier
intro.line: General Ike! Sir, reinforcements have arrived from Begnion!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Reinforcements? I haven't heard anything about this.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Have you, Princess Elincia?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: No, not a word.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you sure they're Begnion troops?

intro.speaker: Begnion Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir! They fly Begnion's insignia. There can be no doubt of their authenticity. And the man in command is one of Begnion's most beloved heroes, General Zelgius! There's no mistaking him, sir!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Allow me to meet with him first.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: I beg your pardon. Are you General Ike?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I am. And you are?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: I am Zelgius, earl of Kadohl. I've been dispatched from Begnion with a battalion to support your army.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Your assistance is much appreciated, but...This is very unexpected.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: I understand your surprise. For Begnion's imperial senate, this decision was made with unusual haste.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I imagine so. It took forever just to get the soldiers I have now.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Well, there's a reason behind this expedited decision. Duke Persis has returned home.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Do you mean Sephiran?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Correct. Duke Persis is also senior statesman of the imperial senate. The duke returned from his travels and began working immediately to settle pressing affairs of state. First, he met with the apostle, and they exchanged reports on both foreign and domestic matters. Then they discussed Begnion's position in relation to the current conflict, and possible courses of action. In less than half a day, they brought the entire imperial senate into line and sent us here to you.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: ...So you're saying that Begnion has allied itself with Crimea. Is that it?

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: That's it exactly. I am at your service, General Ike.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Oh... Um...wow. Thank you.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Now then, please tell me what you would have my men do. I'm ordered to help in any way possible.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Um... You've caught me off guard. I can't think of anything right now.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: In that case, do I have permission to make camp around the palace and rest my troops?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes, please do. That's no problem.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Thank you. Please do not hesitate to call if you have need of us. We are at your disposal.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Begnion reinforcements... That was unexpected, wasn't it?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It certainly was! It seems the apostle and Sephiran did the impossible by getting them to us.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: All for our little army... It's hard to believe they would go to all this trouble.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: First we take Daein's capital, and now this. Things are looking up.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You're right. Even if we don't receive help from Gallia, we still may be able to defeat Ashnard.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: That's true. It's...like a dream.

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: I have to disagree.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Oh, look. Soren is upset again. Who knew?! What is it this time?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: If the Crimean army is not the crux of Daein's defeat, this war means nothing.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: What does that have to do with the arrival of these reinforcements?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: The battalion that just arrived is greater in numbers than the one we originally received. Not only that, but all of these soldiers are marching under Begnion's name.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: So?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: So... If these reinforcements are responsible for defeating King Daein, what do you think will happen? That achievement, the very victory itself, will belong to the Begnion Empire. Not to Crimea. If that happens, Crimea will be rebuilt however Begnion sees fit, and Princess Elincia will be a mere figurehead. And then, the deeds of an unknown mercenary company will be expertly covered up. We'll receive some paltry sum of money and be swept under a rug somewhere. Mark my words.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Soren, you're being so rude! Surely the apostle, of all people, would never do such a thing!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: And this General Zelgius seems sincere enough to me.

intro.speaker: Titania
intro.line: Come, Soren. I have heard of situations like that which you describe, but whether this is such a case... We've been fortunate to receive this good will. Must we always search for such ulterior motives?

intro.speaker: Soren
intro.line: Yes! We must! Have you forgotten Nasir?! It's that sort of naive attitude that allowed him to remain undetected for so long! You people don't seem to get it. We are at WAR! All doubts, no matter how small, must be extinguished. If they aren't, we could well be ignoring something that will lead to our defeat. Or to our death.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Let's take Soren's comments under consideration and discuss this at length. We meet in one hour.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: So you're going to lead a small unit out on a survey mission?

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Yes, that's the plan. However...Though we've taken the castle, there are still pockets of Daein resistance. It's possible they may try to mount an attack and retake the palace. I want you to be in charge of the watch.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: That is, of course, not a problem. However, you're taking the princess along. Don't you think it would be safer to take more troops? Even if we split our battalion, we have enough men to handle both tasks.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I'm just not used to moving around with such a large group. And for this mission... I'd like to keep the number of people involved as low as possible.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: It's not that I don't understand how you feel, but...we will compromise.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You know, for someone from Begnion, you're pretty flexible. It speeds things up considerably.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: To be a soldier, one must be able to quickly adapt to circumstances around him.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right. We'll be back later.

intro.speaker: Zelgius
intro.line: Take care.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: This is the place Nasir mentioned. Palmeni Temple. I hope whatever he was trying to tell me will become clear once we get inside and look around.

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: I still can't believe Nasir was on Daein's side... I just can't. And he let that dragon girl get away... Although I'm sure he had reasons for that, as well.

intro.speaker: Mist
intro.line: I wonder... Was it really Nasir? Although, besides my family, the only people I showed the medallion to were Titania, Princess Elincia, and Nasir... I thought I could trust him... I really did. Why? Why did he do it?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Mist...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Thinking about the past isn't going to help. Let's take a look at this temple.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Here we are. This is Palmeni Temple.

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: What did you say? The Crimean army is here?

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: They want to investigate the temple. What should I tell them?

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Crud! This ain't good. I don't know what they're after, but if they find us mercenaries who sided with Daein, they'll wipe us out!

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: It is all the will of the goddess. Resign yourself to your fate... Accept it.

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Bat dung! No one's gonna roll over and die! Dying's for sissies! So tell me, how many are there?

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: There appears to be ten or so, including the women.

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Gahar har har! That's good news!

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: It is?

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: If that's the lot of them, we can take care of this on our own. It'll be like stealin' a baby from the cradle! Right, then, here's the plan. Pretend like you wanna help 'em, then lead 'em inside. And listen good! You'd best not whisper a word about us being here! Or else...Kkkkccchhhhh!

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: B-but I couldn't... What you ask is beyond me--

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: KKKKCCCCHHHHH!!! Don't forget, we've got all the other priests under our control. Unless you want 'em to meet the goddess early, do as you're told!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: All right, we'd like to take a look around. Please show us each room.

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: Um...very well... Th-th-this...is...Er... A v-very large room... Um...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: Are you all right? Why are you shaking like that?

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: Oh, Goddess... Please...forgive me...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: It's a trap!

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Gahar har har har! You did it!

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: Please...forgive me...

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: I thought something like this might happen.

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: I don't know how you got wind of us, but showing up in such a small group means you're outta luck! None of ya are gettin' outta here alive!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: We've just fought our way to the Daein capital. You're not even going to slow us down!

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Cocky, ain't ya? But who said this was gonna be a fair fight?

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: Eh?

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: What, what are you doing?

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Hey! Bring out the others!

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: You fools are gonna be our shields.

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Gahar har har! Gahar har har har! See? You ain't so useless after all!

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: You filthy dogs! Those are innocent people! You can't...

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: Oh...mercy... Please help me...

intro.speaker: Schaeferr
intro.line: Hey! If ya don't want them perty robes of yours to turn red, you'll attack these scum! If ya even think about betraying us, I'll kill every one of ya!

intro.speaker: Tomenami
intro.line: B-but...you can't......Crimeans, please... Forgive us...We cannot allow our brothers to die.

intro.speaker: Ike
intro.line: This cowardice will not stand! These priests are being made to fight against their will. We've got to try and save as many of them as possible! Let's go!

boss.speaker: Schaeferr
boss.line: Hey, robes! If I get so much as scratched, you better get to healing!

boss.speaker: Schaeferr
boss.line: ...Gwaar... Haaaarr... Haaaaaa...Shoulda brought...more priests...Or some...babies... Dang...

end.speaker: Daein Bishop
end.line: Thank you very much. I never imagined that we would be rescued by soldiers of an enemy nation.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: There was no way we'd cut down innocent priests being forced to fight against their wills. And yet, we were not able to save everyone...

end.speaker: Daein Bishop
end.line: Peace, my lord. We were expecting to be killed at once. Yet somehow you rescued so many of us...I'm sure that even our departed Bishop Tomenami is grateful for your aid.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Father, we bear no ill will toward the kingdom of Daein itself. We wish only to reclaim the homeland which was unjustly taken from us. That is the reason we fight. We had no desire to invade this land. If nothing else, please believe that.

end.speaker: Daein Bishop
end.line: I beg your pardon. May I have the favor of your name?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Elincia Ridell Crimea. I'm the sole survivor of the Crimean royal family.

end.speaker: Daein Bishop
end.line: Oh! You... Let us give thanks that you are alive and well! And please, I beg your understanding as well. There are many Daeins who do not support the king's actions.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I understand.

end.speaker: Tomenami
end.line: Thank you very much. I never imagined that we would be rescued by soldiers of an enemy nation.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: There was no way we'd cut down innocent priests being forced to fight against their wills.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Father, we bear no ill will toward the kingdom of Daein itself. We wish only to reclaim the homeland which was unjustly taken from us. That is the reason we fight. We had no desire to invade this land. If nothing else, please believe that.

end.speaker: Tomenami
end.line: I beg your pardon. May I have the favor of your name?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Elincia Ridell Crimea. I'm the sole survivor of the Crimean royal family.

end.speaker: Tomenami
end.line: Oh! You... Let us give thanks that you are alive and well! And please, I beg your understanding as well. There are many Daeins who do not support the king's actions.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I understand.

end.speaker: Tomenami
end.line: My young general, this is for you.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Huh?

end.speaker: Tomenami
end.line: As thanks for saving our lives.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Now it's time to search this place.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: My lord Ike. May I join you?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Sure, why not? Everyone's lending a--

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ike! Ike! Where are you?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Mist? I'm over here.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ike! This way! Quickly! Reyson's in trouble!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Reyson? What is it?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: He's been like this from the moment he set foot in this room. He's just staring at the walls.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is all this?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Every wall has the same pattern on it.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: It's not a pattern. It's an ancient language. All chants and spells in magic scrolls are written thusly.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Can you read it, Soren?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Some, but not all. Spells are simple, whereas this is a complex narrative. I think Prince Reyson could read it.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: I bet this is the same language that Leanne was speaking.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: It is. It's the Serenes' language...Their chants are all in this language, too.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: So Reyson is reading what's written on the walls?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: It appears that way...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Shall we leave him be? There's a lot of writing here. This could take hours.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: I think that's a good idea.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Ike!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: What is it?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: From what I could gather, I think a person was locked in this room sometime in the past.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: ...You don't know who it was, do you?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I wasn't able to read enough of the writing, but... I found this under the bed.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Is this...?

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: I think it may have belonged to whoever was imprisoned in this room.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I apologize. I took up much of your time.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Reyson, you don't look so good. Why don't you rest for a bit?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: No, I'm fine. It's more important that we talk.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: About the owner of this feather?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: ...Was it in that room?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Soren found it. Whose was it?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Lillia... My older sister. The writing on the walls is hers.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: ...You have an older sister, too?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Will you tell us about it?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: She was kidnapped twenty years ago, on the night of the Serenes Massacre. I...I thought that Lillia had been murdered along with my other brothers and sisters. I believed that until today...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Who took her?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: The walls say only that he was a large human. She probably never knew who it was. He thrust a clan treasure at her and demanded that she use her magic to revive the thing sealed inside it. He exhorted her again and again, but to no avail. Lillia refused his request every time...because she did not possess that power.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Someone wanted to revive the dark god...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Shortly after she was brought here, Lillia fell ill and collapsed. I'm not surprised...it was a terrible time... She was imprisoned in that tiny room with no view of earth or sky...

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Oh, that's awf...sniff.........sniff...

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Mist...

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: I'm sorry...I just feel...so sad for Lillia...and for...for Reyson, too...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I beg your pardon. Let me continue. A young beorc began coming to the room to care for Lillia. She had bluish hair and blue eyes...And her heart was unusually pure for a beorc. In time, Lillia and she came to be friends, and shared a mutual trust.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Ah!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Lillia decided to entrust her hopes to the woman. They shared no common language, so it took some time. But eventually, the beorc woman understood what it was Lillia wanted... Which was to take the treasure and the song...and flee this temple.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: B-Brother!

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Was there anything else written about this beorc woman? A name, perhaps...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: (Elena....) Translated into our language, it was probably Elena.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: I knew it! Mother! It was our mother!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Are, are you sure?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Our mother's name was Elena. Like me, her hair was blue...as were her eyes. Reyson, the object you refer to as your clan treasure was an aged, bronze medallion, wasn't it?

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: How... How did you know that?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The medallion became my mother's keepsake. The song, too... My parents both gave their lives to protect it.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Ike! You and Mist are Elena's children? Then Lehran's Medallion is here?

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: Um...

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The medallion was stolen. Probably by Daein.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: It can't... This is...unbelievable. Can a thing like this be chance?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: To be honest, I don't fully understand all that's happened. But...it all makes sense. It all comes together...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Ah!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Mist...That's the song that... But...the melody's a little different, isn't it?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: It's similar to the song Reyson and Leanne sang in the forest. My mother used to sing it as a lullaby.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: It is the song of release. The one Lillia entrusted to Elena.

end.speaker: Mist
end.line: B-but...I wore the medallion and sang that song almost every single night! And nothing ever happened.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: The magical effect of the song is awakened by the power of the singer. ...It can't be unleashed by just anyone. The true song of release can only be sung by a girl named Altina...Lillia wanted your mother to take the melody to Altina and return the medallion to its rightful place in Serenes Forest.

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: The story's becoming clearer and clearer. My father fled Daein to protect my mother, who was carrying the amulet.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike? How did you know--

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: Volke told me. He told me about my father's past, and the amulet, and the dark god, too.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: So you know everything...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: King Ashnard took Lillia, didn't he?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: That would be the final piece of the puzzle. After all, the man who found my father was the king's henchman.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: Ike! Are you saying you know who killed Commander Greil? You never said anything about that! We all thought his murderer was unknown... Why didn't you say anything?

end.speaker: Ike
end.line: ...I don't know. I never felt like talking about it.

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: He was a Daein soldier, wasn't he? Who was it? Who was the man who killed Commander Greil?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: IKE!! TELL ME!!

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Can we discuss this later?

end.speaker: Titania
end.line: ...Oh... Yes... Yes. Of course.

end.speaker: Soren
end.line: Up to this point, we've all been fighting for the liberation of Crimea. Even if we now add to that stopping the dark god from being released and punishing Commander Greil's killer... Our enemy remains unchanged. King Daein and his henchman are the ones we must defeat.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It's mysterious, isn't it? I mean, Reyson said the same thing earlier, but... Could all of this really be mere coincidence? The fall of Crimea... Ike's parents... The death of Reyson's sister... The fact that everything leads back to Daein...

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Hey, Ike! Er... General Ike! Wait up! Say, if there's an enemy in my way, but I don't want to kill him, what do you think I should do?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: ...Is this about that stupid game again?

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Well, it's all your fault! You had to go and tutor Daniel, and now I've been on this losing streak!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Tutor? You mean back when we were onboard the ship? It was just one hint!

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Daniel isn't like me! He's smart. I'm the one who thought up this game, but he's the one who's getting better and better. I hardly ever win anymore!

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Instead of playing that game, why don't you try some real combat?

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Stop joking around. We're happy-go-lucky traveling merchants. We don't know anything about fighting.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Give me a break! It's nice you're having fun and all, but please... Can you save your stupid game for someone who's not fighting for their life day in and day out?

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Well, what do you expect? Everything's war, war, war, and there's no place for us. All we can do is play this game. Sorry... I'll just go lose again...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Oh, for heaven's sake...Look, if there's an opponent you don't want to kill, just shove him out of the way. Then you don't have to fight him.

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: Huh? Oh, t-thanks. ...Um...You know, we are what we are, but we'll be with you till the end. I hope we can continue to be of service. All right?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Yeah, thanks. Sorry for being so irritable.

conversation.speaker: Jorge
conversation.line: That's all right. I know how much stress you've been under.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Something on your mind?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Oh, Commander Ike! Oops! I guess I'm supposed to call you General now, huh?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Commander's fine. So what's going on? Are you thinking about that person you were looking for?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: That's...all settled. Actually, no... it's not really settled. It's just...I figured that worrying about it all the time wasn't doing me any good. I turned over every rock in Begnion during my search, but... It's just easier to assume that everything's going well...somewhere...

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Well, as long as you're happy, I won't say a word. So...what were you thinking about then?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I...I didn't say anything before, but Daein is my homeland.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: Is that so? Sothe Yeah. Until a few years back, I lived in the slums of Nevassa and stole for a living.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: So anyway, I went back to my old stomping grounds and saw some friends. The rest of the city's empty, but they're still here. They've got no other place to go, you know?

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: And what did they have to say?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Every one was mad that Crimea had won. They said if the king had been here, there's no way they would've been defeated. It's so weird. Until now, all they had ever done was complain about this place.

conversation.speaker: Ike
conversation.line: I see.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: You know, Ashnard wasn't such a bad king. At least, as far as we could see. If you were strong enough, you could rise up and become a knight one day. You could escape the filthy slums. He was the only king who ever gave us that chance. That hope.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Don't get me wrong. I don't mind fighting with all of you. But still, seeing your homeland scarred and trampled like this is tough. I'm sorry. I know Crimea is suffering in the same way, but... I can't change how I feel.
